item.title: Google Cloud Access Transparency
item.description: Vendor Resources Resource Link https://cloud.google.com/log4j2-security-advisory https://cloud.google.com/log4j2-security-advisory Community Notes Source Note CISAGov Product does not use Log4j 2 and is not impacted by the issues identified in CVE-2021-44228 and CVE-2021-45046. CISAGov Last Update: 12/21/2021 Sources Date Attribution Description 2021-12-22 14:51:18 CISAGov Updated communityNotVulnerable.

item.title: Google Cloud Actifio
item.description: Vendor Resources Resource Link https://cloud.google.com/log4j2-security-advisory https://cloud.google.com/log4j2-security-advisory Community Notes Source Note CISAGov Actifio has identified limited exposure to the Log4j 2 vulnerability and has released a hotfix to address this vulnerability. Visit https://now.actifio.com for the full statement and to obtain the hotfix (available to Actifio customers only). CISAGov Last Update: 12/21/2021 Sources Date Attribution Description 2021-12-22 14:51:18 CISAGov Updated communityNotVulnerable.

item.title: Google Cloud Anthos
item.description: Vendor Resources Resource Link https://cloud.google.com/log4j2-security-advisory https://cloud.google.com/log4j2-security-advisory Community Notes Source Note CISAGov Product does not use Log4j 2 and is not impacted by the issues identified in CVE-2021-44228 and CVE-2021-45046. Customers may have introduced a separate logging solution that uses Log4j 2. We strongly encourage customers who manage Anthos environments to identify components dependent on Log4j 2 and update them to the latest version.

item.title: Google Cloud Anthos on VMWare
item.description: Vendor Resources Resource Link https://cloud.google.com/log4j2-security-advisory https://cloud.google.com/log4j2-security-advisory Community Notes Source Note CISAGov Product does not use Log4j 2 and is not impacted by the issues identified in CVE-2021-44228 and CVE-2021-45046. We strongly encourage customers to check VMware recommendations documented in VMSA-2021-0028 and deploy fixes or workarounds to their VMware products as they become available. We also recommend customers review their respective applications and workloads affected by the same vulnerabilities and apply appropriate patches.
